summary: Mayonnaise, often called "mayo," is a thick, creamy sauce used on sandwiches, burgers, and salads. It's made by mixing oil, egg yolk, and vinegar or lemon juice. Mayonnaise can be white to pale yellow and can be as thin as cream or as thick as gel. There are versions without eggs for people with allergies or those who avoid animal products. It's also used to make other sauces like tartar sauce and ranch dressing.
title: Mayonnaise
